---
name: global-conventions
description: Structure Django projects following the standard layout with apps/, settings/, services.py for business logic, and proper file organization using Poetry and Docker. Use this skill when creating new Django apps, organizing project structure, implementing the service layer pattern, managing settings files, configuring URLs, setting up static/media files, creating management commands, or working on project-level configuration files like pyproject.toml, docker-compose.yml, or settings/*.py.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When creating a new Django app or project structure
- When organizing files within a Django app (models.py, views.py, services.py, etc.)
- When implementing the service layer pattern for business logic
- When setting up split settings (base.py, local.py, production.py, test.py)
- When configuring environment variables with django-environ
- When defining URL patterns in urls.py files
- When creating custom management commands
- When setting up static files or media file handling
- When configuring Django admin customizations
- When working on pyproject.toml, docker-compose.yml, or Dockerfile
- When deciding when to create a new Django app
- When setting up pytest.ini or conftest.py for testing
- When writing README.md or project documentation
- When following Git workflow and commit message conventions

# Global Conventions

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle global conventions.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
